reviews.review_msg: Bing really is a super caring and nice teacher. His lectures are always engaging and he makes me want to learn more. I felt happy coming to his class. Super kind person and I would recommend him highly!

He is amazing. Yes he goes on tangents but he cares about everything he teaches. Easily the best prof I've had at SFU highly recommend. Tutorials will go over the readings and the lectures are their own thing.

His lectures are highly unprepared and he just keeps yapping about his personal life. Interesting readings but we don't really talk about them. The tutorial addresses the readings more than the lecture. No slides. Pretends everything is a big revelation when it's the most basic thing we have all heard about already.
Such an unorganized prof with the most unorganized TAS. The lectures were super random and all over the place. Never had slides. He just rambled forever. Worst class I have ever taken by far.

His lectures are always interesting and very inspirational. He doesn't use slides to conduct his lecture, he just uses the readings or artifacts to guide what he discusses. He's hilarious and unlike any Prof I've had. Highly recommend! No quizzes or exams in EDUC240! Just a project at the end of the semester. He doesn't give clear criteria though

I have had Dr. Bingham as my prof for 2 courses (educ 100 and 240) and keep hoping to find another course that he teaches. He is hands down my favourite prof that I have had at SFU. He made the lectures engaging and explained things very thoroughly. He gave really insightful feedback and made learning the content very enjoyable!
Honestly one of the best professors I've ever had. His course has really opened my mind to the world of education and plus he's an amazing person.

Best professor I have ever had, amazing assignments (allows you to be creative), and doesn't pressure you the way other profs do. Really speechless as to how I loved this course and the professor. Fun fact: this was the last in-person lecture I attended before they shut down university for COVID. But really, you'll never regret taking this class.

Great prof. His lectures are very personal, so you really get a deeper understanding of the course topics. His lectures are never boring and he gives readings that help give a deeper understanding of the topics. I definitely recommend taking a course with Dr. Bing.

I seriously love him so much. He changed my perspective in such unique ways and makes education wonderful. I LOVE him. Everyone does. Thank you for being so so so so so so so wonderful! Best class and prof I have ever had in all my years at SFU. hands DOWN!!!

Charles is caring and very inspirational. He makes sure the students learn in an engaging and fun environment. He is well respected and an amazing speaker. Would definitely take more classes with him.

Bing is the best prof at SFU hands down! His lectures are super personal, all you really have to do is go to class with an open mind, and listen to what he says. Tutorials are a must in my opinion, and participation is encouraged. Wish I didn't pass the course so I can take it again. Amazing class!

Charles I found kind of scattered and all over the place with his lectures. He didn't really have a clear structure. The content was interesting but they make the grading for this class hard. I heard it was an easy A and I only got a B.

Bing is an amazing professor.  He encourages students to critically think about so many issues in education as well as the rest of the world.  I took his class last semester and I am constantly referring back to notes and material used in his lectures as all his sources were extremely fascinating.  I definitely recommend this class!

Simply put, THE best professor at SFU. He is no prof like you have ever seen. Keeps you engaged throughout the whole class, and loves his students. One of the most caring teachers I've had in my life. Yeah its a super easy class, but I did not even care about my grade because I was so drawn into hearing him speak. Thanks Bing you're the man!!!

Bing is a really cool prof, this course was definitely a GPA booster too. Our TA Matthew was also amazing. Between the two of them, I loved this course. Really interesting concepts are presented in this court and Bing explains them very well. He also always has lots of stories! I would definitely recommend this course to others!

Bing is so nice, and a very interesting guy. This class is SO easy, while making you think about important things in society. I would recommend this class to everyone, because I think it helps develop compassion. It is a GPA booster, yet also pretty interesting. If you get Matthew as a TA you are lucky, he is AWESOME.

By far the best class I will and have ever taken. Jason is an awesome TA, hes easy to talk to and probably one of the greatest TA's I have ever had. Bing himself is a legend, deserves a standing ovation at the end of every lecture. Thank you for inspiring me to be better. (These are the type of educators that we need).

This class is ONLY easy if you are inspired, love education, and love critically thinking outside the norm.  Best course by far and I cannot believe this is a 200 level class.  EDU 240, taken with Bing and TA-Jason. C. this course is unique, eye opening and truly should be mandatory.  LOVE LOVE LOVE this class.  Sad it was over :(

Really amazing class. Came in skeptical, came out enlightened. Like everyone else has said, take this class. Don't worry about the project; it's not a big deal at all. Jason is the T.A. you want to get. Overall an easy class that I learned a lot from.

The best proff I ever had. He left me mind blown. The only proff's name I will remember. Teaching style was awesome and so was the topics he touched. Take without hesitation any class with him. Give you my word.

This was my last semester to complete my BA and I can say that this class with Charles was my favourite class I have ever taken at SFU.  Thought provoking issues from a professor who is obviously passionate about the topics.

He's an awsome professor, not to mention, a very linent and laid-back one. TA's are very helpful and easy markers. There is no need to come to ANY of the lectures, aside the first (which talks about the four mechanisms) but tutorials are a must. Essays are your choice, relating to your thoughts and opinions on social education. VERY EASY!
No Comments
